attributes.action: Stop companies giving out loans to those on low to no income.
attributes.additional_details: Too many people take out loans and struggle with the monthly payments then decide to take further loans out to help however end up digging a hole for themselves. People with low to no income are managing to obtain loans. £3’000 should be the maximum amount allowed to obtain as long as that individual has a minimum annual income of £16’000+ This serious issue that young people face today has major impacts on themselves and our economy. This has to be resolved immediately.
attributes.background: It is easy for anyone to obtain a loan however once a loan has been obtained they should be automatically denied any further loans. A strict credit and background check should be done on all individuals applying for a loan to prevent uncontrollable debt.

rejection.details:
We're not sure exactly what you'd like the UK Government or Parliament to do. Loan companies themselves decide who to give loans to. 

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do. For example, you could start a new petition asking the Government and Parliament to introduce a duty on the Government to take steps to reduce household debt from loans, if that's what you would like to happen.
